SQL_ATTR_LOGIN_TIMEOUT: %1% seconds is hit before SSO browser authentication flow. This may happen when the server is slow to respond. You can check the server settings or increase the SQL_ATTR_LOGIN_TIMEOUT.
%1% is not a valid SAML authentication flow.

The application had set a SQL_DRIVER_NOPROMPT flag to prevent the driver from opening any dialog or browser Windows. The SSO browser authentication flow requires the driver to open a browser Windows. If you would like to use the SSO browser authentication flow and know that it is safe for the driver to ignore the SQL_DRIVER_NOPROMPT flag, then please set to SSOIgnoreDriverNoPrompt configuration to 1. For details on how to set the SSOIgnoreDriverNoPrompt, please refer to the driver's installation guide.

The server did not set the initialNamespace.catalogName field in the TOpenSessionResp.

The application had set a SQL_DRIVER_NOPROMPT flag to prevent the driver from opening any dialog or browser Windows. The SSO browser authentication flow requires the driver to open a browser Windows. If you would like to use the SSO browser authentication flow and know that it is safe for the driver to ignore the SQL_DRIVER_NOPROMPT flag, then please set to OCIIgnoreDriverNoPrompt configuration to 1.
